Homework Assignment #1¶

Homework assignment can be downloaed from here

Problem #1¶

Consider \(M_{\infty }\) = 2.0 flow of air around the 15% thick diamond airfoil shown. Is the Full Potential Equation valid at any location in the surrouding flow? Fully explain your answer.

Problem #2¶

The Thompson scheme for generating grids is based on equations 10.21 and 10.22 in the textbook. Starting from the following equations used to define the grid:

\[\triangledown ^{2}x = 0\]\[\triangledown ^{2}y = 0\]

Derive equations 10.22. In your derivation of equations 10.22, you will need to use equations 10.21 which define the control terms P and Q.

Problem #3¶

Show that for the parallelogram-shaped grid cell enclosed by \(\overline{ac}\) and \(\overline{ab}\) the cell area is equal to \(\frac{1}{J}\) for the 2-D generalized transformation (assume \(\Delta \xi = \Delta \eta = 1\)).

Problem #4¶

In class it was mentioned that the inverse metrics (e.g. \(x_{\xi}\), \(x_{\eta}\), :math: y_{xi}, \(y_{\eta}\)) could be obtained from finite difference approximations for these derivatives. For example, if we want to find \(x_{\xi}\) at point b in the grid we can use:

\[\left ( x_{\xi} \right )_{b} = \left ( \frac{\partial x}{\partial \xi} \right )_{b} \approx \frac{x_{c} - x_{a}}{\xi_{c} - \xi_{a}}\]

However, we do not use finite difference approximations to find the grid metrics (e.g. \(\xi_{x}\), \(\xi_{y}\), \(\eta_{x}\), \(\eta_{y}\)). Explain why we do not use approximations like:

\[\left ( \xi_{x} \right )_{b} = \left ( \frac{\partial \xi}{\partial x} \right )_{b} \approx \frac{\xi_{c} - \xi_{a}}{x_{c} - x_{a}}\]

to obtain the grid metrics.

Problem #5¶

Complete Problem 5.37 in the textbook.
